getSettingsDescriptionId().Description: Gets the resource id of the description string to use for this source in system search settings, or 0 if none has been specified.

getImeOptions().Description: Gets the input method options specified in the searchable attributes. This will default to @B_android#view#inputmethod#EditorInfo#IME_ACTION_GO_E@ if not specified (which is appropriate for a search box).

Returns: The value of the @B_android#R#styleable#Searchable_includeInGlobalSearch_E@ attribute, or false if the attribute is not set.
shouldIncludeInGlobalSearch().Description: Checks whether the searchable should be included in global search.

Returns: The default intent action, or null if not set.
getSuggestIntentAction().Description: Gets the optional intent action for use with these suggestions. This is useful if all intents will have the same action (e.g. @B_android#content#Intent#ACTION_VIEW_E@) This can be overriden in any given suggestion using the column @B_android#app#SearchManager#SUGGEST_COLUMN_INTENT_ACTION_E@.

Returns: a bitmask indicating the set of special object types marshaled by this Parcelable object instance. Value is either 0 or @B_android#os#Parcelable#CONTENTS_FILE_DESCRIPTOR_E@
describeContents().Description: Describe the kinds of special objects contained in this Parcelable instance's marshaled representation. For example, if the object will include a file descriptor in the output of @B_android#os#Parcelable#writeToParcel_E@, the return value of this method must include the @B_android#os#Parcelable#CONTENTS_FILE_DESCRIPTOR_E@ bit.

Returns: A resource id, or 0 if no language was specified.
getVoiceLanguageId().Description: Gets the resource id of the spoken language to recognize in voice search.

Parameters: Parcel: The Parcel in which the object should be written.
int: Additional flags about how the object should be written. May be 0 or @B_android#os#Parcelable#PARCELABLE_WRITE_RETURN_VALUE_E@.
writeToParcel(android.os.Parcel, int).Description: Flatten this object in to a Parcel.
writeToParcel(android.os.Parcel, int).FullName: public void writeToParcel (Parcel dest, int flags)

getInputType().Description: Gets the input type as specified in the searchable attributes. This will default to @B_android#text#InputType#TYPE_CLASS_TEXT_E@ if not specified (which is appropriate for free text input).

getSuggestSelection().Description: Gets the selection for obtaining search suggestions.

Returns: the max results count, if specified in the searchable activity's metadata, or 0 if not specified.
getVoiceMaxResults().Description: The maximum number of voice recognition results to return.

getSuggestPackage().Description: Gets the name of the package where the suggestion provider lives, or null.

shouldRewriteQueryFromData().Description: Checks whether the text in the query field should come from the suggestion intent data.

Returns: The search suggestions authority, or null if not set.
getSuggestAuthority().Description: Gets the search suggestion content provider authority.

queryAfterZeroResults().Description: Checks whether this searchable activity should be queried for suggestions if a prefix of the query has returned no results.

Returns: The suggestion path, or null if not set.
getSuggestPath().Description: Gets the content provider path for obtaining search suggestions.

Returns: A resource id, or 0 if no voice prompt text was specified.
getVoicePromptTextId().Description: Gets the resource id of the voice prompt text string.

Returns: The default intent data, or null if not set.
getSuggestIntentData().Description: Gets the optional intent data for use with these suggestions. This is useful if all intents will have similar data URIs, but you'll likely need to provide a specific ID as well via the column @B_android#app#SearchManager#SUGGEST_COLUMN_INTENT_DATA_ID_E@, which will be appended to the intent data URI. This can be overriden in any given suggestion using the column @B_android#app#SearchManager#SUGGEST_COLUMN_INTENT_DATA_E@.

getVoiceSearchLaunchWebSearch().Description: Checks if voice search should start web search.

getVoiceSearchEnabled().Description: Checks if the searchable activity wants the voice search button to be shown.

getVoiceSearchLaunchRecognizer().Description: Checks if voice search should start in-app search.

Returns: The suggestion threshold, or 0 if not set.
A resource id, or 0 if no language model was specified.
getVoiceLanguageModeId().Description: Gets the resource id of the voice search language model string.

getSearchActivity().Description: Gets the component name of the searchable activity.

shouldRewriteQueryFromText().Description: Checks whether the text in the query field should come from the suggestion title.

Parameters: Parcel: The Parcel in which the object should be written.

int: Additional flags about how the object should be written. May be 0 or @B_android#os#Parcelable#PARCELABLE_WRITE_RETURN_VALUE_E@. Value is either 0 or a combination of @B_android#os#Parcelable#PARCELABLE_WRITE_RETURN_VALUE_E@, and android.os.Parcelable.PARCELABLE_ELIDE_DUPLICATES
writeToParcel(android.os.Parcel,int).Description: Flatten this object in to a Parcel.
writeToParcel(android.os.Parcel,int).FullName: public void writeToParcel (Parcel dest, int flags)

autoUrlDetect().Description: Checks whether this searchable activity has auto URL detection turned on.

Returns: A resource id, or 0 if no hint was specified.
getHintId().Description: Gets the resource id of the hint text. This must be read using the searchable Activity's resources.

ClassDesc: Searchability meta-data for an activity. Only applications that search other applications should need to use this class. See
